intro: Wahlenbergia nutabunda var. erythraeae, commonly known as the Red-flowered Wahlenbergia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. This variety is distinguished by its vibrant floral coloration and is a sought-after species among horticultural enthusiasts.
